company_name: Ho Chi Minh City Development Joint Stock Commercial Bank
company_profile: Ho Chi Minh City Development Joint Stock Commercial Bank (HDB), formerly known as Ho Chi Minh City Housing Development Bank, was established in 1989. The Bank has its main business in mobilizing capital and granting credit. HDB has been listed and traded on Ho Chi Minh Stock Exchange (HOSE) in late 2017 and early 2018 repectively. In 2024, compared to the same period, The net interest margin (NIM) stood at 5.21%, reflecting an increase of 0.37%. The non-performing loan ratio was at 1.93%, increasing of 0.14%. The coverage ratio for non-performing loans (NPL) was at 68.71%, increasing of 2.89%. the net profit after tax of the parent company is valued at VND12.8 trillion, increased 26.73%. The return on equity (ROE) was at 25.79%, up 1.06%.
history_dev: February 11, 1989: Ho Chi Minh City Housing Development Bank (HDBank) was established under Decision No.47/QD-UB; June 06, 1992: Transformed into Ho Chi Minh City Housing Development Joint Stock Commercial Bank with a charter capital of VND5 billion under the operation license No.0019/NHGP issued by the State Bank; August 2008: Increased the charter capital to VND49.726 billion; November 2007: Increased the charter capital to VND1,000 billion; August 2010: Increased the charter capital to VND2,000 billion; January 2011: Increased the charter capital to VND3,000 billion; September 19, 2011: Renamed Ho Chi Minh City Development Joint Stock Commercial Bank; June 2012: Increased the charter capital to VND5,000 billion; December 2017: Increased the charter capital to VND9,809,99 billion;  December 25, 2017: Listed on Ho Chi Minh Stock Exchange (HOSE); January 05, 2018: Traded on Ho Chi Minh Stock Exchange (HOSE); October 28, 2020: Increased the charter capital to VND12,707.76 billion; December 24, 2020: Increased the charter capital to VND16,088.48 billion; October 27, 2021: Increased the charter capital to VND20,072.90 billion; June 29, 2022: Increasing charter capital to VND 20,272.90 billion; November 2, 2022: Increased charter capital to VND 25,303.42 billion; August 29, 2023: Increased charter capital to VND 29,076.32 billion; October 8, 2024: Increased charter capital to VND29,276.32 billion; December 26, 2024: Increased charter capital to VND35,101.42 billion;
business_risk: Circular 36/2014/TT-NHNN also causes some difficulties for the banking system, narrowing credit limits, limits on government bond investment, solvency protection ratio, ratio of short-term capital for medium and long-term loans. This requires banks to restructure their asset and liability portfolios to comply with regulations. This restructuring affects the results as well as business strategies of banks. In addition, there are still many difficulties in completely handling outstanding bad debts when there is still a lack of real financial sources from outside while the legal framework for bad debt trading still has many shortcomings.
key_developments: Mobilizing capital; Granting credit; Financial investment and cooperation; Trading foreign currencies; International banking; Risk management and capital protection;
business_strategies: Becoming a dynamic and multi-functional retail bank closely approaching the international management standards; Executing the retail banking strategy; Developing the model of investment bank with the core divisions are Funding and Currency Trading under the support of securities companies, fund management companies; Developing profitable financial investment plans and diversify financial investment models.
